name: DIVERSION! Hainan Airlines A330-300 Landing and Takeoff at Calgary Airport (4K)
description:
On January 23rd, this Hainan Airlines A330-300 diverted to Calgary. Originally flying from Shanghai to Seattle, poor visibility in Seattle and most of the west coast that day caused this cargo-only flight to divert here. They spent a couple hours on Apron 9 before departing again and successfully making it into Seattle.

Interestingly though, just a few years ago, this would have been an entirely normal sight. Hainan Airlines actually flew passenger flights between Calgary and Beijing from 2016 up until 2019. In October of 2019 though, the route became seasonal, with plans to return in the summer of 2020, which obviously didn't happen.

Still, nice to see Hainan here again! Enjoy the video.

FLIGHT INFORMATION
Airline: Hainan Airlines (CHH/HU)
Aircraft: Airbus A330-343 (A333)
Flight Number: HU445
Livery: Standard (with Film Festival sticker)
Engines: 2x RR Trent 772B-60
Registration: B-8118 
Route: Shanghai (PVG) - diversion to Calgary (YYC) - Seattle (SEA)
Callsign: HAINAN 445 heavy
Runway used: 35R arrival, 35L departure
Date filmed: January 2022
